content:
After much messing around with the router including doing a firmware upgrade I found the following method to work:
  1. Plug a network cable into the router and into your computer (because this may not be easy via wireless).
  2. Reset your router to factory defaults. This can be done by holding down the button at the back with a pin or pen until the light marked "ACT" starts flickering rapidly.
  3. Get the MAC address of the router that Virgin Media sent you. As you will need the same MAC address before the cable/modem will talk to your Vigor router.
  4. Login to your Vigor router and click "Interent Access setup" > "Static or Dynamic". Then set "Broadband Access" to Enabled, set "Obtain IP address automatically" and then specify the MAC address from your previous router.
  5. Save the settings.
  6. Turn your router off
  7. Turn your cable modem off.
  8. wait 5 minutes.
  9. Turn them both back on again and you should have a working internet connection.
title: Using a Draytek Vigor 2900G Router with a Virgin Media Internet Connection
name: using-a-vigor-2900g-with-a-virgin-media-internet-connection
